page.title: 15Population statistics
page.content: C M Is popular as a retirement area as can be shown by the fact that 30% of the population of 2300 are pensioners. Of the working population some 30% are involved with the holiday industry. This work is seasonal as most of the gift shops, restaurants and cafes are only open in summer. At the height of the season the population increases threefold. Approximately 25% of those in employment work in the manufacturing industries. These jobs are mostly outside the village at Ilfracombe and Barnstaple. The unemployment rate is about the national average. There are 196 children at the CM Primary School and 201 travel to the Comprehensive School in Ilfracombe by bus. There are approximately 60 pre-schoolage children in the village.
